title: Ticket #1735: AccountGroup can't be set by SUBMIT_EXPRS
description:
When using accounting groups, the typical form is something like this in the submit file: 
+AccountGroup="group_staff.adesmet"

Both halves are necessary for proper prioritization.

A given submit machine might be exclusively used by a single group. The admin might want to automatically add the correct group, reducing mistakes. The admin might try something like this in his configuration: 

AccountingGroup = strcat("group_staff.", Owner)
SUBMIT_EXPRS = $(SUBMIT_EXPRS) AccountingGroup

This doesn't work, as AccountingGroup is only ever read with AttrList::LookupString, not AttrList::EvalString.

Proposed: an administrator should be able to automatically add a suitable AccountingGroup to jobs using SUBMIT_EXPRS.

Option 1: EvalString

Change all uses of LookupString on ATTR_ACCOUNTING_GROUP to EvalString.

Pros: Leverages existing Condor functionality. Potentially allows further clever tricks with other functions an attributes.

Cons: The policy to set is non-obvious. The AccountingGroup might change when re-evaluated; will that cause problems? (Already a potential problem thanks to condor_qedit, but with an expression it might change while the negotiator is considering it.)

Option 2: Break user off of AccountingGroup

If the AccountingGroup lacks a specific user (say AccountingGroup="group_condor.") assume the Owner of the job.

Pros: Simple to use, both for job submitters and admins.

Cons: May require changing a bunch of code; ATTR_ACCOUNTING_GROUP is looked up about 13 times in our code base. They would presumably need to be replaced with a unified "GetAccountingGroupFromClassAd"

Option 3: Break AccountingGroup into two fields

Instead of AccontingGroup containing the user and the group, have it only contain the group and add AccountingGroupUser to hold the user name. eje has an extended proposal that includes this at https://lists.cs.wisc.edu/archive/condor-devel/2012-January/msg00017.shtml
